meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed an antibiotic for the bacterially infected wound.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the bacterially contaminated water sample.
meanings.sent3: The bacterially contaminated petri dish seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The bacterially infested area was a breeding ground for harmful microorganisms.
meanings.sent5: The smell in the room was so strong, it was as if the air itself was bacterially tainted.

meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The virus spread bacterially throughout the population.
meanings.sent2: The bacteria moved bacterially through the soil.
meanings.sent3: The toy cars raced around the track bacterially, mimicking the movement of microorganisms.
meanings.sent4: The news of the outbreak spread bacterially, causing panic among the residents.
meanings.sent5: The rumors about the new student spread bacterially, reaching every corner of the school.
